alert.note: Alert for Wise (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 28 at 4:41AM EDT until July 28 at 6:15AM EDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM EDT THIS MORNING FOR CENTRAL WISE COUNTY... At 441 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated the thunderstorms that had produced the heavy rainfall had now moved out of the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen since the rain began early this morning. Additional rainfall amounts of up to 1 inch are possible as more rain showers are about to move back into central Wise County. Flash flooding is still possible. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that may still experience flash flooding include... Wise, Pound and Pardee. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
